page.title: 13THE GRANBY CAMPUS
page.content: The development of this campus began in the early 1950's with the building of{Harrogate Technical High School}on land previously owned by Granby Farm. In 1957{St. John Fisher R.C. Secondary {Modern School}was built, later to be followed in 1962 by{St. Robert's R.C. {Primary School.}Another school{Granby {Secondary Modern}was added in 1965. Reorganisation of Education in Harrogate in 1973 brought great changes with St. John Fisher School moving to a new site and the three senior schools amalgamating to become{ {Granby High School.} This became the largest school in the town - a Comprehensive School with over 2000 pupils.
